Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a single task in a to-do list.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Task entity.

completed.description: Indicates whether the task has been completed.

createdDate.description: The date and time when the task was created.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. The userId is the Firebase Auth UID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores tasks associated with a specific user. Tasks are owned by the user, using the path-based ownership pattern. The userId is used to identify the owner.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user who owns the task.

params.name: taskId
params.description: The unique ID of the task.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure and scalable solution for TaskMaster, a to-do list web application.  It leverages path-based ownership for user tasks to ensure data privacy and simplifies security rules. Authorization Independence is achieved as there is no `get()` calls made in rules. Segregation of data is achieved by storing tasks under each user document.
